name: Berryâ€“Robbins problem
rephrased: Does a continuous map exist from the configuration space of n distinct points in 3D space to the flag manifold U(n)/T^n that is invariant under the symmetries of the configuration space?
implication_form: If a continuous map respecting the symmetries exists between these spaces, then it satisfies certain properties (but the core question is the existence itself, not a conditional statement).
